cyclone.name: ETA
cyclone.current_location: about 115 mi ESE of Marathon, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking north-northwest through the Florida Straits tonight, forecast to turn west into the southeastern Gulf of Mexico Monday–Tuesday, then meander in the eastern Gulf before lifting north toward the northeastern Gulf late week

weather_observation.watch_coast: N/A – all watches confined to South & Central Florida and adjacent Keys
weather_observation.warning_coast: N/A – warnings confined to South & Central Florida and adjacent Keys
weather_observation.impacted_coast: South Florida peninsula, Florida Keys, portions of the west coast of Florida and northeastern Gulf of Mexico
weather_observation.wind: Minimal tropical-storm-force wind risk (≤3% chance of 34-kt winds). Occasional gusty breezes possible late week if the remnants pass offshore.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for the Virginia coast under current forecast track.
weather_observation.rainfall: Moisture from Eta could bring 1–2 inches of rain to the Mid-Atlantic late in the week, but widespread heavy totals are not anticipated at the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated seas and long-period swells along Atlantic shipping lanes could disrupt vessel schedules late week.
